Also, there was no real reason for you to be against the Templars in AC3. You're just told that they are evil and so deserve to die, and so you follow. They don't really have much of an evil master plan, they just seem to want to be in control. Also, the reason Connor hates them, his village being burned, comes out of nowhere with no justification. Even Hatham doesn't even know it happened.
The game gives you no motivation to be behind Connor, and this, coupled with an increasingly uninteresting story as the plot progresses, caused a lot of people to just become bored by the game.
